meanings.definition: Food or liquid that is spilled or splashed
meanings.sent1: The dog licked up the slop from the floor.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to make a mess with the slop on the table.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought it was fun to play with the slop on his plate.
meanings.sent4: The slop of colors on the artist's palette blended beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The slop of soup looked unappetizing but tasted delicious.

meanings.definition: To spill or splash liquid or food
meanings.sent1: She accidentally slopped water on the counter.
meanings.sent2: Please don't slop your drink while walking.
meanings.sent3: The chef slopped sauce everywhere, creating a messy kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The rain slopped over the sides of the gutter.
meanings.sent5: The waves slopped against the boat, causing it to rock gently.

meanings.definition: A watery or liquid mixture of food for animals
meanings.sent1: The pigs eagerly devoured the slop in their trough.
meanings.sent2: The farmer prepared a fresh batch of slop for the livestock.
meanings.sent3: The ducks quacked happily as they ate their slop.
meanings.sent4: The zookeeper carried buckets of slop to the animal enclosures.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the slop attracted all the hungry animals.

meanings.definition: To feed animals with a watery or liquid mixture of food
meanings.sent1: The farmer slops the pigs every morning.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys slopping the chickens in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper slops the animals with care and precision.
meanings.sent4: He slops the horses before dawn breaks.
meanings.sent5: Slopping the cows is a daily chore on the farm.
